alert.note: Alert for Dickens; Kent; King; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 28 at 8:22PM CDT until May 28 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN KENT...SOUTHEASTERN DICKENS...SOUTHWESTERN KING AND NORTHWESTERN STONEWALL COUNTIES... At 822 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southwest of Girard, or 9 miles northwest of Jayton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Jayton, Girard and Swenson. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
